result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Fecarotta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
MUST SUBMIT DNA SAMPLE.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Anthony M Fecarotta in court by video with attorney .  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony M Fecarotta in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.
